description: TO ELECT A SPEAKER FOR  THE 68TH CONGRESS.  FREDERICK GILLETT, (R) RECEIVED 197 VOTES, FINIS J. GARRETT (D) RECEIVED 195 VOTES, HENRY A. COOPER (R) RECEIVED 17 VOTES, AND MARTIN B. MADDEN RECEIVED 5 VOTES.  VOTES FOR GILLETT ARE CODED 2, GARRETT 1, COOPER 5, AND MADDEN 6.  NO NOMINEE RECEIVED A MAJORITY OF THE VOTES CAST, SO NO CHOICE WAS MADE.
Issue1: Election of the Speaker of the House

description: TO ELECT A SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES FOR THE 68TH CONGRESS.  FREDERICK GILLETT (REP) RECEIVED 194 VOTES, FINIS GARRETT (DEM), 194 VOTES, HENRY COOPER 17 VOTES AND MARTIN MADDEN (REP), 6 VOTES.  VOTES FOR GILLETT ARE RECORDED AS 2, FOR GARRETT AS 1, FOR COOPER AS 5, FOR MADDEN AS 6.  SINCE NO NOMINEE RECEIVED A MAJORITY OF THE TOTAL VOTE CAST, THERE WAS NO CHOICE.
Issue1: Election of the Speaker of the House

description: TO ELECT A SPEAKER FOR THE 68TH CONGRESS.  ON THIS BALLOT, GILLETT RECEIVED 195 VOTES, GARRETT 196 VOTES, COOPER, 17, AND MADDEN, 5.

description: TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON H.RES. 1, PERMITTING EDWARD E. MILLER TO TAKE THE OATH AS A REPRESENTATIVE FROM THE 22ND DISTRICT OF ILLINOIS.
TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON H. RES. 94, NAMING THE MEMBERS OF THE STANDING COMMITTEES OF THE HOUSE.

TO AMEND H. RES. 146, THAT THE RULES OF THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES OF THE SIXTY-SEVENTH CONGRESS BE ADOPTED AS THE RULES OF THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES OF THE SIXTY- EIGHTH CONGRESS, WITH CERTAIN AMENDMENTS, BY INSERTING A NEW SECTION, AND ELIMINATING ALL OF CLAUSE 3, OF RULE XXI.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO H. RES. 146, A RESOLUTION THAT THE RULES OF THE 67TH HOUSE BE ADOPTED AS THE RULES OF THE 68TH HOUSE.  THE ORIGINAL AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT 100 SIGNATURES MAY DISCHARGE A BILL FROM COMMITTEE; THE AMEND- MENT AFFERED BY GRAHAM WOULD REQUIRE A MAJORITY OF MEMBERS ASSENT FOR DISCHARGE.
TO AMEND H. RES. 146, BY PROVIDING TO CHANGE FROM 150 TO 100 THE NUMBER OF SIGNATURES REQUIRED TO DISCHARGE A COMMITTEE FROM FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF A BILL.  (P. 162-1)
TO AGREE TO THE THIRD PART OF H. RES. 146 RELATING TO DISCHARGING COMMITTEES FROM CONSIDERATION OF BILLS.
TO PASS H.R. 62 (1/16/25), CREATING TWO JUDICIAL DISTRICTS WITHIN THE STATE OF INDIANA.

TO AMEND H.R. 5078 (6/5/24), MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR FOR FISCAL 1925, BY PROVIDING THAT THE OFFICERS OF REGISTERS AND RECEIVERS IN CERTAIN LAND BE CONSOLIDATED.  (P. 1294, 1295-1)
